required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study to Investigate the Bioequivalence of Lacosamide Tablet (200mg) and Syrup (10mg/ml) in Healthy Chinese Male Subjects
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized, Open-Label, Single-Dose, 2-Period Crossover Study to Investigate the Bioequivalence of Lacosamide Tablet (200mg) and Syrup (10mg/ml) in Healthy Chinese Male Subjects

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to demonstrate bioequivalence between the LCM tablet and syrup after single oral dosing in healthy Chinese male subjects.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Blood samples are collected at predose and 0.25, 0.5, 1.0, 1.5, 2, 3, 4, 6, 8, 12, 24, 36, 48, and 72 hours after dosing
primary_outcome.description: Blood samples will be taken at indicated time points to determine maximum Lacosamide (LCM) plasma concentration.

primary_outcome.measure: Area under the LCM plasma concentration-time curve from time zero up to the time of last quantifiable concentration (AUC[0-t])
primary_outcome.time_frame: Blood samples are collected at predose and 0.25, 0.5, 1.0, 1.5, 2, 3, 4, 6, 8, 12, 24, 36, 48, and 72 hours after dosing
primary_outcome.description: Area under the LCM plasma concentration-time curve from time zero up to the last quantifiable concentration data point, computed using the log-linear trapezoidal rule.

primary_outcome.measure: Area under the LCM plasma concentration-time curve extrapolated to infinity (AUC)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Blood samples are collected at predose and 0.25, 0.5, 1.0, 1.5, 2, 3, 4, 6, 8, 12, 24, 36, 48, and 72 hours after dosing
primary_outcome.description: Area under the LCM plasma concentration-time curve extrapolated to infinity calculated as AUC(0-t) + t/z, where t is the estimated plasma concentration at time t and z the terminal elimination rate constant.

secondary_outcome.measure: Terminal plasma elimination half-life (t1/2) of LCM
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Blood samples are collected at predose and 0.25, 0.5, 1.0, 1.5, 2, 3, 4, 6, 8, 12, 24, 36, 48, and 72 hours after dosing
secondary_outcome.description: Terminal elimination half-life of LCM, reported in hours, as determined via simple linear regression(slope=-z) of natural log (ln) concentration vs time for data points in the terminal phase of the concentration-time curve. tÂ½ is calculated as ln(2)/z.

secondary_outcome.measure: Time of observed Cmax (tmax) of LCM
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Blood samples are collected at predose and 0.25, 0.5, 1.0, 1.5, 2, 3, 4, 6, 8, 12, 24, 36, 48, and 72 hours after dosing
secondary_outcome.description: Time of observed Cmax will be obtained directly from the plasma concentration-time curves.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Blood samples are collected at predose and 0.25, 0.5, 1.0, 1.5, 2, 3, 4, 6, 8, 12, 24, 36, 48, and 72 hours after dosing
secondary_outcome.description: Apparent plasma clearance calculated as CL/F=Dose/AUC.

secondary_outcome.measure: Apparent volume of distribution (Vz/F) of LCM
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Blood samples are collected at predose and 0.25, 0.5, 1.0, 1.5, 2, 3, 4, 6, 8, 12, 24, 36, 48, and 72 hours after dosing
secondary_outcome.description: Apparent volume of distribution, calculated as Vz/F=(CL/F)/z.

arm_group.description: Single administration of Treatment A (single dose of Lacosamide (LCM) 200 mg, given as 2 tablets of LCM 100 mg under fasting conditions, followed by a Wash-Out Period of at least 7 days and a single administration of Treatment B (single dose of LCM 200 mg given as syrup) under fasting conditions

Single administration of Treatment B (single dose of LCM 200 mg given as syrup) under fasting conditions, followed by a Wash-Out Period of at least 7 days and a single administration of Treatment A (single dose of Lacosamide (LCM) 200 mg, given as 2 tablets of LCM 100 mg) under fasting conditions

intervention.description: Treatment A: Single dose of Lacosamide (LCM) 200 mg given as 2 tablets of LCM 100 mg
Treatment B: Single dose of Lacosamide (LCM) 200 mg given as syrup

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Subject is a Chinese male between 18 and 40 years of age
- Subject has no clinically significant cardiovascular, renal, gastrointestinal, hepatic, metabolic, endocrine, neurological, or psychiatric abnormalities and is in general good health
- Subject confirms that during the study and for a period of 3 months after the final dose of study drug, when having sexual intercourse with a woman of childbearing potential, an acceptable birth control method will be used
Exclusion Criteria:
Clinically significant
- out of range values for hematology and clinical chemistry variables
- abnormality in physical examination or vital signs
- ECG finding Any clinical conditions that in the opinion of the investigator would make the subject unsuitable for the study
